Pre-Game Insights: New Zealand and Pakistan will face each other in Match No. 35 of the World Cup 2023 on November 04, 2023, at M. Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bangalore.
New Zealand has suffered three successive defeats and is currently experiencing a slump in form.
Pakistan has three victories in seven outings so far in the tournament.
New Zealand's premier seamer Matt Henry has been ruled out of the remainder of the competition due to a hamstring injury, and Kyle Jamieson has replaced him in the squad.
The match is crucial for New Zealand as they need a win to stay ahead of Pakistan and Afghanistan in the race for a place in the final four.
Pakistan returned to winning ways by defeating Bangladesh in their last match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Head-to-Head: New Zealand and Pakistan have met each other 115 times in ODI cricket, with New Zealand winning 51 times and Pakistan winning 60 times. One game ended in a tie, and three games had no result.
Fakhar Zaman needs ten runs to complete 5000 runs in international cricket.
